content.description: The first route you'll come to on the lower left side of the Upper Replica. Start beneath the aesthetic blue streak and climb through awesome sustained techy crimps and rails to a crux up high. A chain anchor is located directly below the small dead snag on the prow. 10 bolts

Start with a small two finger pocket 15' up from Summer BluesÂ and boulder up and right through a small seam, eventually joining up with the Pato Peligro crack. At the top of the crack move left and climb through technical terrain on awesome rock and holds to a chain anchor on a small ledge. Stick clip the first bolt. 11 bolts

Start at the right end of the wall beneath a right rising finger crack. Follow the crack to its end, then trend left to the awesome chert mailbox slot. Continue left to gain a seam that will take you all the way to the top. Classic Wolverine technical route and a great warmup. 13 bolts

Climb big sweeping moves through a right arching crack in the center of the Upper Replica to gain one of the raddest chert features in Wolverine, the duck head! Then fire into the thick technical face guarding the anchors. 13 bolts
Unfinished route with old line hanging on it right of Don't Trad on Me. Started by Henry Schlotzhauer. It would be pretty cool if someone finished this. I know Henry wont mind. Should be a good one!
content.location: The back side of the Upper Replica

content.description: Start just up the hill of Pancake Power on a small flat section of hill below a blank section of wall. Crimp through the entry boulder problem and then climb through cracks with ever easing difficulty to the top. Although the bottom is well bolted the higher you go the more run out it gets. If you like routes with a bit more of a mental element, this is your jam. 10(?) bolts
content.protection:
Quickdraws, could take some gear

Chain anchor

content.description: Start 15' Feet up from Pato Peligro's crack and launch into technical squeezing through right trending parallel seams to gain a tricky no hands below the large undercling half way up. From here, fight through the thin techy slab to chain anchors on a small ledge. Amazing stone! 14 bolts

The first route on the overhanging wave on the backside of the Upper Replica. Start up the small gully bellow the large obvious overhanging flake. Climb through a techy pocket sequence to gain the large flake then lieback, undercling, and sidepull your way to the top. Slightly intimidating. Women have also been sighted climbing this route topless. 8 bolts (Note: This was bolted as a lieback so if you climb it as a straight on splitter I imagine that the clipping might feel a bit awkward)
content.location:
The Wave Wall

Located on the back side of the Upper Replica

content.description: Start 10' right of Rat Brain and follow the right trending black bolts through the dirty looking slab. Currently there is no anchor!!
